tweets.text:
This blog from @WildHaweswater is an inspiring read.

Several of our geomorphologists have been involved alongside colleagues from @EnvAgencyNW & partners supporting this project to restore morphological diversity - increasing #biodiversity, decreasing #flood risk https://t.co/2lGjRZsDUT

"We constantly innovate to do more with less. But ultimately we will get the environment we pay for. A core part of that is funding the @EnvAgency properly." 

My letter to @thetimes quoted in their article about cuts to UK regulators today. https://t.co/9qGJ8JzWBf

Full text 👇 https://t.co/BNpdhz7Z8a

After receiving reports from a member of the public, two @EnvAgency field operation officers removed tree branches that were blocking part of the River Blyth in Stannington Vale #Northumberland We appreciate all of the helpful information received from local residents #floodaware https://t.co/ggBQbk6VUa

tweets.text:
@LacLaurence @TheENDSReport @ScottishEPA @EPAwater @EnvAgency There's a useful overview talk from the @CaBAtweets data and evidence forum on YouTube (second presentation in the afternoon session).  
https://t.co/qp7CmUGav1
@leeinthelakes @JamieHutt0n @AquaUoS @EnvAgencyNW @WildHaweswater @NECumbria @unitedutilities @ThrimbyFarms Is that Hobgrumble Gill at the far end? Fabulous name!

Yes good to see some analysis to explain the capacity gap that exists between rising environmental ambitions & the ability to deliver on that. @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency ready to do the job, but we need the means https://t.co/bEZkSXnDPm
The floodplain in Swindale doing its thing earlier today. #nfm https://t.co/KfL1O8AKaK

tweets.text:
The UK's wild oyster population has declined over 95% due to over-harvesting, habitat loss & pollution.

We're delighted to be working with the @Wild_Oysters project and @EnvAgencyYNE to restore the 20,000 square kilometres of oyster reefs lost in the North East of England 🦪 https://t.co/mvspWHXO8k

tweets.text: How come @robertjenrick Planning White Paper has NO detail and asks for NO feedback on the #environmental, #biodiversity and #heritage effects of the plans? If are planned protections are purposefully unclear. @NaturalEngland  @HistoricEngland @EnvAgency https://t.co/jSDlzodRaK

Brilliant @Unchecked_UK report shows effects of severe funding cuts at @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency on enforcement. They need major capital & revenue investment at #SpendingReview to fulfil current functions, let alone deliver the #EnvironmentBill & #ELM.

https://t.co/CCvpt8Gk7O

Looks pretty but this is the waterless source of the River Ivel. Even recent heavy rain can’t make this poor chalk stream flow. Pitiful! ⁦@IvelRev⁩ ⁦@FriendsRib⁩ ⁦@Chilternstreams⁩ ⁦@OliverHealdUK⁩ ⁦@Feargal_Sharkey⁩ ⁦@AffinityWater⁩ https://t.co/oamx2mSS60

tweets.text:
Scientists are now testing sewage samples to detect local #coronavirus outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.

This is a valuable step in supporting NHS Test and Trace.

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbk0ofA

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/4xdR82CtJo

tweets.text: UK’s enforcement capacity has been massively eroded over a number of years to the huge detriment of our natural environment @NaturalEngland and @EnvAgency with far too little being done #lawtonreport and now #PlanningWhitePaper pays lip service to #ClimateChange https://t.co/tbsbeTwUwk

Following public feedback proposals for an essential 1.1km flood wall in West Kirby have been redesigned to take on board local suggestions. Detailed plans for the new flood wall, will be officially lodged this week. https://t.co/t7H8LZLyvu @EnvAgency https://t.co/UCA4piY50Z
@Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd EBH joined the board of the @EnvAgency in 2009. What has she done about it during the last 11 years? @BBCWomansHour

Has anyone been prosecuted for the pollution incident in the River Mole at South Molton last year, when 10,000 fish were killed in what was thought to be a leak of anaerobic digester effluent? That was over a year ago. @EnvAgencySW  https://t.co/dlolYqSXy2

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text:
Yesterday, @DaveThroupEA tweeted a video of salmon at a weir. 

Today, with only my small lens I went to hopefully capture my first glimpse of the salmon run in the wild. 

Oh my god - just incredible. I somehow managed these photos! 

@BBCCountryfile @bbcweather @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/YWEv3V9no4

How many other rivers in England are having vast amounts of raw sewage dumped into them at this very second? "Exceptional circumstance"?

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/8rarB1lphZ
@marty_mcfly27 @Im_THE_CJ @WirralCouncil @EnvAgency Thought that was you out on your sailboard
@cambo691 @Im_THE_CJ @WirralCouncil @EnvAgency Come on mate. Just ask me next time 🤣🤣🤣

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text: Research by experts @EngineeringNCL & @NorthumbrianH2O to identify traces of Covid-19 in sewage is helping to give early warning of local outbreaks & supporting public health teams   https://t.co/r3mcQP3ny4 @EnvAgencyYNE
@Im_THE_CJ @WirralCouncil @EnvAgency Cool well spotted

This 👇. I don’t normally comment on politics, but regulation and enforcement is probably the only thing that @EnvAgency can do that partners can’t. We must resource it properly if we want the environment to improve. https://t.co/Y8MF7sCkAD
Greenwashing at it’s finest, and the perpetrator of this obscenity? Why the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/KniMhKoCwV

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes "Our rivers and bathing waters are in a much better state than 20 years ago".

Does someone actually read this stuff?

Let me remind you, in 2016 14% of rivers in England reached 'Good' overall environmental health. 

In 2019? Err? None!

Time to go.

https://t.co/8J3kNikmZL
On @BBCWomansHour today- #whpowerlist this year is about Our Planet  : who has the real power to make change? Guests include @EmmaHowardBoyd @envagency and @CleanIlkley

@CleanIlkley @EmmaHowardBoyd @BBCWomensHour @KarenShackleto5 The very people who created this sorry situation are now trying to suggest they can fix it. 

I've said it before the @EnvAgency have no credibility left in this conversation.

tweets.text: @JohonSchepe @UnderwaterMedia @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @thetimes Bollocks. This is a systemic metro-centric govt problem. Govts of all hues have been looking the other way and DEFRA & EA officials have allowed it to happen. They just can't ignore the evidence any more.

Our staff have been working with @EnvAgencyMids and @BhamCityCouncil to renaturalise parts of the River Cole, adding curve, creating habitats & improving conditions for fish and invertebrate population movements. It’s part of our vision to improve the river for wildlife & people https://t.co/4xPmOEt3Aa
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/IpnaNQ1Ucf
